subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] how to spell words with /tS/
msgSnippet: Yes, this is one of the reasons it s good to have a plain-text format! Ted
messageBody:
Yes, this is one of the reasons it's good to have a plain-text format!

Ted

On Dec 4, 2007 9:36 PM, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> John Cowan wrote:
>
>
>
> Paul Tremblay scripsit:
>
> > I am editing a large word base right now, generated from getting
> > phonetical pronunciations from words, and I keep coming across words
> > like "branch" and "beach" which my program has transliterated,
> > according to the pronunciations, as /<font face="Thoth
> Sampa">bratS</font>/
> > and /<font face="Thoth Sampa">bits</font>/. This seems wrong. It seems
> > they should be spelled /<font face="Thoth Sampa">brac</font>/ and /<font
> > face="Thoth Sampa">bitc</font>/.<br>
>
> They should indeed. tS and dZ are the IPA way of writing "ch" and "j",
> and there is no effective difference between the one and the other.
>
> Thanks. I see that my QS is not coming through for all as QS, but as <font
> face=...>. It came through for me, at least.
>
> Paul
>
>
>
